lines.text: To see your world in a grain of sand, and a heaven in a wild flower. Hold infinity in the palm of your hand, An eternity in an hour. William Blake.
[Lara sees the UPS man staring at the dilapidated house]
I woke up this morning and I just hated everything.
[Hilary meets Lara outside the shower with something other than a t-shirt]
Oh... very funny.
I'm only trying to turn you into a lady.
Mm...
[walks past him and drops the towel she was wearing]

[sighs]
And a lady should be modest.
Yes, a *lady* should be modest.
Into the belly of the beast.
And out of the demon's ass.
So, time to save the universe again then, is it?
Absolutely
Lara Croft, I don't believe it. Still pretending to be a photojournalist? Ya know, I think it's really cool that you can still keep a day job, though it's obviously just for show.
So, Alex, still pretending to be an archaeologist?
Lara, do we always have to fight like this? Maybe we don't.
Hmm, maybe we do.
Why?
You stole my prayer wheels!
Stole? Stole? Coming from you? It's not like you ever really owned them or anything. Hey, you're the tomb raider...
Oh look, I think your clients need you. As you once said, so memorably, "It's all just a business". So go, go do business.
[last lines]
[Lara Croft enters dressed "properly" to see Hilary and Bryce standing and grinning]
What?
[Bryce takes a picture of her]
[the revamped training robot enters the room]
Hmm.
[Hilary takes the covering off the serving tray to reveal Lara Croft's trademark guns, and smiles]
[Lara Croft grabs the guns and film ends with a freeze-frame]
It's a clock... It's ticking.
Oh... one of those ticking clocks, eh?
But you might try to kill me.
I'm not going to kill you.
I said you'd try.
Lady Croft, tell me, is there a good reason why I just kept you alive?
Yes. That is not the true eye.
This is the true eye.
It's not, actually. It's a mirror image.
Ms. Croft, I think you're trying to cheat me out of my little ray of sunshine.
Why would I try and cheat you out of anything, now, I need you to get the piece so I can steal it from you later.
You're bluffing! Julius, make a mental note, kill Ms. Croft if she attempts any such thing.
Yes, sir.
Well we can do it my way, or we can all come back in time for the next allignment and you're welcome to try and kill me then, in oh, say, another 5,000 years?
Was it programmed to stop before it took my head off?
Ah well... that would be a... no.
What's that smell?
Five AM
[Alex West turns around to find Lara Croft sitting]
Hello, Alex.
I suppose you think I'm a greedy, unscrupulous sell-out who'll do just about anything for money?
Yes. That's right.

[shrugs]
Well, the money bit's true I guess.
Is it, Alex? If you cross me, we may not be able to remain friends.
[Looks him up and down]
Always a pleasure.
Now for a *cold* shower...
Me bum's gone to sleep again, all down the left cheek.
Really? That's fascinating.
[first lines]
[after an extended action sequence with a training robot which then attempts to revive itself and sneak up on her]
Stop!
We have 83 rooms. Why can't you live in the house?
Well, I'm a free spirit, me.
Lara, it's a clock, it ticks, it tells the time.
[looks at his watch]
It's wrong.

[taking screws out of clock to open it]
... screw 13 to quadrant 3, screw 14 to quadrant 4...

[sighs and rolls eyes]
Please.
It's my system! So I know where they all came from!
It's camouflage.
[takes hammer and smashes the clock to pieces]

[wincing]
Okay.
But time was stolen from us and it's not fair.
No, it's not fair.

[after reading the ancient writing in the tomb]
Right, so... Pretty much touch anything, and you get your head chopped off.
This is where I start to have fun.
If we don't get that piece then we'll have to wait five thousand years for another alignment.
I don't know about you but I'm not planning to give that much time to this enterprise.
This isn't a country, it's an ice cube!
My ignorance amuses me... My ignorance amuses me?
Yes well I've always found your ignorance quite amusing.
How are you going to get to Cambodia and get the clock back in... 15 hours?
I'll be calling in a favor.
What kind of favor?
Well, that is a secret.If a told you, I'd have to kill you.
Ah, Mr Powell.How Predictable.Alex West.What are you doing here?
